name: Are You A Freddy Fanatic? Quiz | Musicals | 10 Questions

questions.text: Who originally played Freddy on Broadway?
questions.explanation:
Norbert Leo  Butz.

	Norbert Leo Butz won a Tony award for his role as Freddy, beating fellow cast member John Lithgow.

questions.text: What family member does Freddy talk about, in order to swindle people from their money?
questions.explanation:
His ailing grandmother.

	Stories of a conveniently absent grandma provide Freddy with the cash he needs to survive.

questions.text: Where do Freddy and Lawrence first meet?
questions.explanation:
A train.

	The big question is: Can the two con men get along?

questions.text: Freddy shows up at Lawrence's house and realizes that he could be filthy rich if he were to hit the big time! In his song "Great Big Stuff", which one of these material goods is mentioned first?
questions.explanation:
Paisley silk pajamas.

	Freddy wants some paisley silk pajamas to go with his house in the Bahamas.

questions.text: Beaumont Sur Mer isn't big enough for both Lawrence and Freddy. The first to swindle someone out of some money will stay, the other must leave. How much money must be raised?
questions.explanation:
Fifty thousand dollars.

	A cool fifty grand is also the amount that Average Joe's needs to win to keep their gym in the movie "Dodgeball".

questions.text: Lawrence enlists the help of Freddy to dissuade Jolene, an overeager would-be paramour, from marrying him. Lawrence, in his guise as a deposed prince, introduces the crazy Ruprecht. In the original song, what does Ruprecht fear most?
questions.explanation:
The genital cuff.

	"Ruprecht, do you want the genital cuff?" asks the original version of "All About Ruprecht". It's sung by David Yazbek, who wrote the music and lyrics to "Dirty Rotten Scoundrels".

questions.text: To get the money and win the contest, Freddy dresses up as a soldier, Buzz Benson. Which body part(s) of his don't work?
questions.explanation:
His legs.

	Freddy and Christine Colgate, who is to be swindled, sing a love song called "Love Is My Legs" in Act 2.

questions.text: What does Christine believe finally heals Freddy in his disguise as Buzz?
options: He accidentally moves the afflicted body part
questions.explanation:
Her love.

	The love of Christine Colgate's money REALLY "cures" Freddy of his debilitating injury.

questions.text: As Freddy and his paramour go to kiss, they bump heads and Freddy is knocked out. When he wakes up, what does he have on?
questions.explanation:
His underwear.

	"And here I am a schmuck in a robe!". Freddy wakes up in his underwear and quickly puts a robe on and confronts Lawrence, whom he holds responsible!

questions.text: As the show reaches an end, who finally stays in Beaumont Sur Mer?
options: They both leave for greener pastures
questions.explanation:
Both Freddy and Lawrence.

	Freddy and Lawrence are joined by Christine, who reveals herself to be yet another con artist known as "The Jackal"! She conned them out of fifty thousand dollars, but really, staying in such a nice town is its own reward, even though they both technically lost the bet.
